block.p: Sarah Curtis Hand, a doctoral candidate in early American history, was married yesterday to Scott Blackford Meacham, an architectural historian in Washington. Maj. David L. Duncan, the chief deputy sheriff of Charlottesville, Va., officiated there at the Chapel of the University of Virginia, where the bride is a student and the bridegroom received a master's degree in architectural history.

Mrs. Meacham, 27, graduated from Smith College and received a master's degree in history at Vanderbilt University. She is the daughter of Jo-Anne H. Hand and Michael C. Hand of Stamford, Conn. Her father is the president for apparel and home textiles of the NPD Group, a market research firm in Port Washington, N.Y. Her mother is the membership director at the Southwestern Area Commerce and Industry Association of Connecticut, a business advocacy group in Stamford.

Meacham, live in Anchorage, Alaska, where his mother retired as the librarian at the Abbott Loop Elementary School and his father, a lawyer, has his practice.
